oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Life Magazine Cover
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This image, entitled Living Emblem of the United States Marines, depicts 100 officers and 9,000 enlisted men making out the famous globe & anchor insignia of the United State Marine Corps. Photographs of this type were taken from large towers and were extremely popular with military units in World War I. This one was taken at the Marine Barracks, Paris Island, South Carolina, Brigadier General J. H. Pendleton, commanding. Camp Pendleton, California is named in his honor.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
